content: Oh hey guys in my latest play vids

chaos type magic and it's very hard to control so the so the most modern-day
well you know relatively modern day mages in the campaign use the arcane
they don't mess with the eldritch but the eldritch can be very powerful but
it's also very chaotic so these damage crystals were causing havoc in the game
any time someone could would cast magic or cast spells these would move towards
the person and could shoot at them with a randomly rolled effect also this
jibber cam out of one in my game was chasing the players around it was
babbling incoherently and could cause people to go kind of insane
like minor insanity like a temporary insanity so that was interesting so they
had to try to deal with these things at the table and it was pretty interesting
how they did that but I want to show you what those look like first and here's
the largest chunk of one but I want to show you what those look like
and then now go to the I'll go to the table and talk about how I crafted these
the basis of my project is this construction styrofoam that you use
it's an insulation foam it's that they have pink it's they come in pink and
blue and you put them on the side of houses to insulate the house now I'd
like to use the to inch width foam but this stuff is great because it's it's
very solid like it has a lot of strength compared to the styrofoam that beats up
and just breaks apart so it's nice to carve and it's nice to carve detail into
with an engraving tool so what I do is I use the the hot wire foam factory
sculpting tool and sculpt out Johnny I'll draw the shape on there the sides
and then I'll sculpt it out with this now you can see say on this one here you
know I would have taken a piece and then kind of dragged it dragged it dragged it
dragged it dragged it and so I kind of wanted to make that chaotic shape as far
as like different planes on the on the piece itself but I also did kind of a
fleshy inside which I thought it'd be cool there'd be like a shell on the
outside and then kind of like a fleshy inside so to do the all the detail on
these you can't use the sculpting tool but I use this engraving tool which is
really nice because they have a short one that's that the the point is pretty
close to the where you hold where you hold the tool so it give you a lot of
control over your of your actions when you draw stuff on here so you know
I drew that I drew out the shell part of the lines and then the runes on the
different piece on the different facets of this and on the inside I want to have
kind of like this amorphous magic looking stuff so I carved it out like I
just you know did around the edge and then carved it out like that so they
gave a really I think a really nice effect on that and so yeah those are
just the two sculpting tools I used for this and then you can see it has I did a
base the base is just a wood base it's a wood
see that you can get from craft stores you can you really use anything for a
base but I use the woodsy because I drilled a hole in the center and then I
used the cocktail or the the barbecue skewer for the stand of this and they're
just painted it black I also did a little bit of rubble on the base with
just the construction sand and that helps give it a little weight to to hold
up so yeah I think those came out really nice and I did a budget you know I did a

one has two sides of the fleshy part that still has some of the shell you
